Section.Catchline: Documents required while working in a massage establishment.

Subsection.Text: In order to provide the department and law enforcement agencies the means to more effectively identify, investigate, and arrest persons engaging in human trafficking, a person employed by a massage establishment and any person performing massage therein must immediately present, upon the request of an investigator of the department or a law enforcement officer, valid government identification while in the establishment. A valid government identification for the purposes of this section is:

Paragraph.Text: A valid, unexpired driver license issued by any state, territory, or district of the United States;
A valid, unexpired identification card issued by any state, territory, or district of the United States;
A valid, unexpired United States passport;
A naturalization certificate issued by the United States Department of Homeland Security;
A valid, unexpired alien registration receipt card (green card); or
A valid, unexpired employment authorization card issued by the United States Department of Homeland Security.

Subsection.Text: A person operating a massage establishment must:

Paragraph.Text: Immediately present, upon the request of an investigator of the department or a law enforcement officer:

SubParagraph.Text: Valid government identification while in the establishment.
A copy of the documentation specified in paragraph (1)(a) for each employee and any person performing massage in the establishment.

Paragraph.Text: Ensure that each employee and any person performing massage in the massage establishment is able to immediately present, upon the request of an investigator of the department or a law enforcement officer, valid government identification while in the establishment.

Subsection.Text: A person who violates any provision of this section commits:

Paragraph.Text: For a first violation, a misdemeanor of the second degree, punishable as provided in s. 775.082 or s. 775.083.
For a second violation, a misdemeanor of the first degree, punishable as provided in s. 775.082 or s. 775.083.
For a third or subsequent violation, a felony of the third degree, punishable as provided in s. 775.082, s. 775.083, or s. 775.084.
